text: hey everybody thomas joseph here from
kitchen conundrums now every celebration
deserves a beautiful cake but has this
ever happened to you
where you've gone through the effort and
the time to make a cake and what you end
up with is something that isn't frosted
evenly the layers to your cake might not
be all the same and a little lopsided so
today i'm going to show you some
essential techniques that will have you
decorating and assembling your next cake
like a pro so we're going to get rid of
this guy here and we're gonna start from
scratch
now a few items that you're going to
need if you really want to take cake
decorating and assembly seriously I
suggest that you invest in one of these
this is a rotating cake stand and it
makes it so easy to assemble cut layer
and decorate cakes one other essential
item I would say is having a long
serrated knife like this anything that's
short is not going to cut even layers
for you now whenever I'm baking and
assembling layer cakes I like to make my
cake in advance and I like to freeze
them overnight it really helps when you
go to slice your layers because your
cake is very firm now make sure to peel
off the parchment from baking and I have
a cardboard round here which is a bake
shop trick it's a easy way to transport
your fully assembled cakes I'm going to
invert one of my layers and this is a
9-inch chocolate cake but the method
here it's all the same regardless of
what cake you're planning on using so
now I'm going to trim off this dome and
what you should do use your serrated
knife and go along the edge of the cake
just as it starts to crown and we're
going to trim off this domed portion so
I'm rotating the cake as I cut and the
reason why we're getting rid of this
dome is so that we have nice flat even
layers so don't discard this this is
perfectly good you can give this to the
kids it is delicious
so now we have to slice this cake layer
in half so we're at about an inch here
since we've trimmed off the dome and I
am going to use toothpicks now these are
going to help me they're going to be a
wonderful guide in cutting nice even
layers at the half-inch mark place a
toothpick and then do this a few times
around the circumference of the cake and
what this does is it acts as a guide so
that when you glide your knife around
you will have nice beautiful even layers
okay so now take your your knife here
and as you turn your lazy susan make
sure that you hit the guides that you've
set in place so once you have your mark
and you've created a cut you can remove
your toothpicks here and again it's
turning the cake stand and sawing back
and forth with your serrated knife so
that looks good
I have two beautiful layers two even
layers and I'm ready to cut my second
cake so repeat the process so now the
cake layers are cut and now we're ready
to assemble so one little trick here
taking a little bit of frosting and I'm
using a Swiss meringue buttercream today
and put it on the bottom here so your
cardboard round doesn't move around as
you frost just give it a little bit of a
press this layer we'll come back to now
the cake layers are still cold that's
the beauty of freezing the cake they
stay nice and firm so that you can lift
them easily and they don't crumb too
much so now for layering with frosting
favorite tool right here I love using an
ice cream scoop it helps to portion out
the perfect amount of frosting so I'm
going to use two scoops here now you can
also use a measuring cup I just find
that these ice cream scoops with the
release makes a quick job real fast here
and then every single layer you're going
to build with two scoops of your
frosting so you know that you'll have
even layers taking a little offset
spatula work from the center of the cake
out to the sides
so once it's evenly spread now try not
to go right to the edge I would say
leave a quarter inch border because once
you start stacking you're going to
compress that frosting down and it's
going to squeeze out towards the side so
don't go all the way to the edge I like
to rotate the stand a little bit to
smooth out the center and if you have a
little bit of extra you can put it right
back into your bowl so now it's time for
the next layer and you're gonna repeat
this process until you get to the top so
now I have the final layer and I'm
actually going to invert this and this
is the bottom of one of the cake layers
so that bottom really has a nice flat
surface so that looks great there and
now I'm going to crumb coat the cake
which is a very important step in crumb
coating all it really is is a thin layer
of frosting and what it does is it locks
in all of those crumbs and what you're
going to do is you're going to work from
the center out to the sides and then
down the sides of your cake go with
gravity so working the frosting on the
top out to the sides of the cake take
your spatula and work down the sides of
the cake as you can see there are plenty
of crumbs stuck in this layer of
frosting so this is going to go into the
refrigerator now until it is firm about
thirty minutes maybe an hour so our cake
has been in the refrigerator for about
thirty minutes
pile on some of your buttercream
frosting be generous again using your
offset spatula here you're going to work
the frosting out to the outside and then
down the sides and you can see I'm
flattening out the top here just by
rotating the cake stand keeping my
offset spatula flat against the cake and
what it does is it pulls away any excess
frosting so that'll give you a nice
smooth top now scrape off your frosting
in between smoothing and then you're
going to work down the sides just like
we did before and we'll smooth it out
once we have it all work down the sides
if you notice the very bottom of your
cake has a little pocket
that's free of frosting and you need
some you can always just add it onto
your spatula and turn your cake stand
and it should fill in that gap nicely so
now smooth out the sides again you're
going to hold your offset spatula at a
90 degree angle and you're just going to
spin the cake stand and it will evenly
smooth out your frosting and now to fix
the top as you can see smoothing out the
sides it pushes the frosting up and an
easy way to remove that is just to
quickly swipe the frosting in towards
the center so swipe it in just like that
make sure that you wipe in between these
swipes so now we're ready to serve and I
am so excited to share with you what the
